segments.text: I observe the boy's position carefully.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: He is balanced on a small, two-step stool.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The legs of the stool are noticeably splayed outward.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's leaning precariously backward, almost teetering.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Any slight shift in weight could send him tumbling down.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: He's reaching up, stretching his body towards the cookie jar.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: His hands are occupied, one in the jar, the other holding a plate.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This makes him less stable, more prone to losing balance.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is standing close by, perhaps too close if he falls.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can practically hear the clatter of the stool and the cookies.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The thought of him falling on the hard kitchen floor makes me wince.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Someone needs to intervene before an accident occurs.
segments.speaker: PAR
